block.p: Valerie Witoshkin and Charles Garrett Fox were married yesterday by the Right Rev. Vincent Saverino at St. Michael the Archangel Russian Orthodox Church in Philadelphia.

The bride, 36, works in New York as the investment manager for hedge fund allocations at the Alkimia Group, a private investment office of the Kaplan family, whose businesses in South America and Europe include retailing and real estate development. She graduated from Boston University. The bride is a daughter of Natalie Witoshkin and Walter Witoshkin of New Hope, Pa.
Valerie Witoshkin and Charles Garrett Fox were married yesterday by the Right Rev. Vincent Saverino at St. Michael the Archangel Russian Orthodox Church in Philadelphia.

The bride, 36, works in New York as the investment manager for hedge fund allocations at the Alkimia Group, a private investment office of the Kaplan family, whose businesses in South America and Europe include retailing and real estate development. She graduated from Boston University. The bride is a daughter of Natalie Witoshkin and Walter Witoshkin of New Hope, Pa.

The bridegroom, 43, also works in New York, where he is the president and the chief operating officer of the energy division of ZeroPoint Clean Tech, a company that specializes in renewable energy technology. From 2001 to 2006 he was the deputy secretary for energy and the environment in the administration of Gov. George E. Pataki of New York. The bridegroom graduated from the University of Massachusetts and received a law degree from Syracuse. He is a son of Carol N. Fox and Richard S. Fox of Victor, N.Y.
